intro: Schrankia paucijuga, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Schrankia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and parts of Georgia. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are composite, consisting of both ray and disk florets, which are typically yellow in color. Schrankia paucijuga is often found in moist, sandy soils along the edges of wetlands and in pine flatwood habitats.
